metadata.title: CVE-2021-43531 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
When a user loaded a Web Extensions context menu, the Web Extension couldaccess the post-redirect URL of the element clicked. If the Web Extensionlacked the WebRequest permission for the hosts involved in the redirect,this would be a same-origin-violation leaking data the Web Extension shouldhave access to. This was fixed to provide the pre-redirect URL. This isrelated to CVE-2021-43532 but in the context of Web Extensions. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 94.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
